result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth J Nelson in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Kenneth J Nelson. Atty. Broze provides an update; she has an offer and needs time for her client to complete counseling.  Atty. Broze requests the matter be set for status in about 60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:35 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth J Nelson in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Kenneth J Nelson.  Atty. Broze provides an update, she just received an offer and would like more time to discuss that with the the State and her client.  Atty. Broze requests a further proceedings in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

08:22 AM Defendant Kenneth J Nelson in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
